acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: There is a statement of rat LC50: 0.5mg/L (RTECS (2004)) and it was set to Category 2 when exposed for 4 hours. But it cannot be classified since there was no statement of time of exposure. (It is more desirable to be set as Category 2 from safety perspective, when there are necessities, such as a display.)

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale:
SPECIES: Mouse
ENDPOINT: LD50
VALUE: 1310 mg/kg
REFERENCE SOURCE: RTECS(2004)

carcinogenicity.rationale: It was considered as the outside of Category since the classification of ACGIH was A4.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) and the oxygen is chemically bonded only to carbon (but not to other elements).

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Not classified because of "Flash point: 460degC" (Hommel, 1991) and a non-pyrophoric solid at a room temperature.

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: May damage fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into category 1B based on dexcription that the Camphor can be used as a drug to which a miscarriage is urged (PIMs (1988)), and it was reported that the pregnant drank by mistake and carried out the miscarriage (HSDB (2005)).

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: There is no data and we could not classify it.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Not classified because it is not classified in UNRTDG Class: 4.2.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Although based on the statement of stimulating to the eyes in humans (ICSC (2003), HSDB (2005)), it was segmented into Category 2B, however, subdividing into 2A and 2B is not possibile. When the subdividing for the indications, etc. are necessary, it is more desirable to be set as Category 2A from the viewpoint of safety.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was classified as Category 2 from the statement that it caused two burns in exposure of 4 hours (infant) - 50 hours to the gauze containing camphor (HSDB (2005)).

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: We classified it as Category 1 based on the statement that allergic reactions occurs in human skin by chronic exposure (HSDB (2005)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: There was a statement which has a rise of liver leaking enzyme and liver pathological change including a hepatic granuloma (granulomatous hepatitis) in long term ingestion to humans (HSDB (2005)), and since it was priority2, it was classified into Category 2 (liver).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification:
Category 1 (nervous system, kidney),
Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
Causes damage to organs (nervous system, kidney)
May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Classified into Category 3 (respiratory irritant) based on the description about respiratory irritation (ICSC (2003)), into Category 1 (nervous system) based on the description that its accidental ingestion, etc. showed symptoms such as spasm, epilepsy, coma, respiratory depression, headache, confusion and visual impairment, all which are effects on central or other nervous systems (PIMs (1988), HSDB (2005) and ICSC (2003)), and into Category 1 (kidney) based on the description that comparatively little ingestion induces kidney damage (PIMs (1988)).
